p: We consider a set Ω of N 1-km square grid cells, from within each of which n hosts are assessed (using a detection method with given performance characteristics) every Δ t units of time. We aim to identify which Ω (that is, arrangement of surveillance sites) gives the highest probability of detection ( p(Ω, n, Δ t)) before the state-wide prevalence threshold is reached. In the current study, we allowed each site to be selected only once. Because complete enumeration of all possible arrangements is not feasible for a problem of this scale, we used a stochastic optimisation algorithm, simulated annealing, with an exponential cooling schedule [ 41] to approximate the optimal arrangement of sites, using the output of the simulation model. More details of the algorithm are provided in S1 Text.
